name: debatably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not clear or certain, because different people may have different opinions: His latest documentary is debatably the least controversial. The breakup of the organization is debatably overdue and will be good for democracy.
More examplesFewer examplesThe report asserted, somewhat debatably, that no development sites remained in the area.The hike to Everest Base Camp was debatably the highlight of the holiday, with sparkling snow and crystal clear water.The award for best player went, perhaps debatably, to Mike.
